Class AbstractCommand

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Client.Commands.AbstractCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
Command
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbandonGameCommand, AcceptCreditsCommand, ActivateDoubleCannonCommand, ActivateDoubleEngineCommand, ActivateShieldCommand, ChooseShipWreckCommand, DecideToRemoveCrewMembersCommand, DestroyTileCommand, DiscardComponentTileCommand, DisconnectCommand, EnterGodModeCommand, FinishBuildingCommand, FlipHourglassCommand, GetBlockCommand, LandOnAbandonedStationCommand, LandOnPlanetCommand, ManageGoodBlocksCommand, MoveGoodBlockCommand, PickCardCommand, PickCoveredTileCommand, PickStandByComponentTileCommand, PickUncoveredTileCommand, PlaceAstronautCommand, PlaceBrownAlienCommand, PlacePurpleAlienCommand, QuitCommand, RemoveCrewMemberCommand, RemoveGoodBlockCommand, ResolveEffectCommand, ShowAllShipsCommand, ShowAvailableCommandsCommand, ShowBankCommand, ShowCurrCardCommand, ShowCurrPhaseCommand, ShowFlightboardCommand, ShowLeaderboardCommand, ShowPileCommand, ShowRemainingSecondsCommand, ShowShipCommand, ShowStandByComponentTilesCommand, ShowTileInHandCommand, ShowUncoveredComponentTiles, StandByComponentTileCommand, SwitchGoodBlocksCommand, WeldComponentTileCommand
public abstract class AbstractCommand extends Object implements Command
AbstractCommand provides a base implementation for commands in the game. It serves as an abstract class adhering to the Command interface, encapsulating common functionalities for command execution, input validation, and interaction with the VirtualServer and ViewAdapter. Concrete command implementations should extend this class and provide specific behavior for their defined use case.

    • isInputValid

      public boolean isInputValid(ClientModel model)
      Validates the input parameters for this command. By default, this method checks that the number of input parameters matches the expected input length, which is zero unless overridden.
      Specified by:
      isInputValid in interface Command
      Parameters:
      model - the client model, can be used for context-aware validation
      Returns:
      true if the input is valid; false otherwise

    • getInputLength

      public int getInputLength()
      Returns the expected length of the input list for this command. The default implementation returns 0, indicating no input is required. Subclasses should override this method if they expect input parameters.
      Specified by:
      getInputLength in interface Command
      Returns:
      the expected number of input parameters (default is 0)
